item.title: Megan add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "But when a woman decides to sleep with a man, there is no wall she will not scale, no fortress she will not destroy, no moral consideration she will not ignore at its very root: there is no God worth worrying about." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Megan add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Over the years they both reached the same wise conclusion by different paths: it was not possible to live together in any other way, or love in any other way, and nothing in this world was more difficult than love." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Megan add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Whenever he saw the sea, or a fire, he fell silent, impressed by their elemental force." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Megan add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "If there hadn't been a sixth day, man would not exist; copper would always be copper; and lead just lead. It's true that everything has its Personal Legend, but one day that Personal Legend will be realized. So each thing has to transform itself into something better, and to acquire a new Personal Legend, until, someday, the Soul of the World becomes one thing only." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Megan add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Megan add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast." -- Gabriel García Márquez
